intro: Sophora masafuerana, commonly known as the Masafuera Sophora, is a flowering plant native to the island of Masafuera in the Philippines. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated, woody pods, and the plant typically grows in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
